title: China rumours: World-record $275m Bayern star bid
text:
China Rumour Mill: Lewandowski, Bony, Deeney, Podolski, Robben FOX SPORTS January 8, 2017 12:12pm 
AFTER capturing Carlos Tevez and Oscar, the Chinese Super League has made its next approach for another big-name target. 
Plus the next former Premier League star who’s set for a move to the Far East. 
With the transfers links continuing to roll in, here’s a wrap of the China rumours. 
LEWANDOWSKI TURNS DOWN ENORMOUS OFFER 
Bayern Munich striker Robert Lewandowski has rejected a mega-money offer from the Chinese Super League, according to his agent. 
The Polish striker, who recently signed a new contract to stay at the German giant until 2021, was offered a salary higher than Carlos Tevez in a $275 million move to an unnamed Chinese club. 
Lewandowski’s agent, Cezary Kucharski, told SportoweFakty: “I was contacted by an agent who brings stars to China. The club name wasn’t mentioned. If Lewy had decided to move to China, his salary would have been significantly higher than €40m, which means more than Carlos Tevez earns.” 
Kucharski added: “It’s obvious: Lewy is not only younger but also a better player than Tevez. Robert is not for sale right now,” but I never say never. Life offers several solutions.” A photo posted by Robert Lewandowski (@_rl9) on Dec 13, 2016 at 6:34am PST 
ROBBEN TO CONSIDER CHINA SWITCH 
But Lewandowski’s teammate, Arjen Robben, says he will consider a move to the Chinese Super League or MLS at the end of the season. 
However, the Dutch winger hasn’t ruled out staying at the Allianz Arena for another campaign. 
“Everyone has to personally assess this,” said Robben. 
“You must never say that this is not an option. But also do not say that you want to go. 
“I am now at Bayern. Of course, I plan a little, I talk to my wife. I am now at the top level. You must see what comes next. 
“My family comes first, but the life experience, living elsewhere - in the USA, in China - might come. But maybe not. Maybe I’ll go back home [to the Netherlands]. I do not rule out anything.” media_camera Bayern Munich's Dutch midfielder Arjen Robben. 
PODOLOSKI TO MOVE TO CHINA 
However, former Bayern star Lukas Podolski is set to move to Chinese club Beijing Guoan, according to Galatasaray director Levent Nazifoglu. 
The former Arsenal star has spent the last few years at the Turkish club, but now looks set for a move to China. 
Nazifoglu told press in Antalya: “The transfer of Lukas Podolski to Beijing Guoan is in its final stage. The player is in favour of the move; it has to happen this week or it won’t.” 
However, Galatasary will reportedly only sell Podolski to the Chinese club on their own terms. media_camera Lukas Podolski. 
TWO PREMIER LEAGUE STRIKERS TO CHINA 
Troy Deeney and Wilfried Bony are the latest Premier League stars to be linked with moves to China, according to reports. 
Watford captain Deeney is reportedly unhappy at Vicarage Road and Hebei China Fortune are keeping tabs on him, according to The Mirror. 
The Chinese club is prepared to pay up to £25 million for the striker. After scoring just four goals this season, there’s a chance Watford may want to let him leave. media_camera Watford's English striker Troy Deeney. 
Manchester City’s 28-year-old Ivory coast striker Bony, has been offered a £210,000 a week tax free, according to The Star. 
Bony, who is on loan at Stoke, reportedly has a clause in his deal that allows him to negotiate with Chinese Super League clubs in the January transfer window. 
But Bony will reportedly stay at Stoke to make his mark, instead of moving to China and possibly linking up with Deeney at the same club. media_camera
